Articles.Content: I have a following problem. I play 0.90 where parachute's deployment pressure is set to 0.38 by default. When I want to tweak it in VAB, for any chute I can't set lower pressure than 0.01 and that makes drogue chutes useless. Does anybody remember if there was any fix for that? Or where to change the default values for parts?

Why would you want to set the pressure below 0.01 atm? Parachutes don't work in vacuum.

 

If you insist, check the parts folder in Gamedata/Squad/Parts, look for your desired part, and edit the config file.

I want to use them on Mars in RSS, 0.01atm treshold is too high

But the problem is not in the part itself, drogue is set to 0.007 in it's config. It's the VAB (or in-flight) tweaking menu, where the lowest possible value is 0.01. But if I don't enter the menu, parachute would be set to the default pressure of 0.38atm. This is the question, how to extend tweaking range? Or how to change the default?

You can do a lot with ModuleManager config.  Don't have a KSP computer in front of me right now, so I can't give you an authoritative answer (or ModuleManager snippet) at the moment, but I believe you can set the min / max / default via ModuleManager config.  (This also has the side benefit of being separate config of your own, rather than altering the game's native config files, so your changes don't get wiped when you do a KSP version upgrade.)
